comments.body: Yes add a zero tick piston to bedrock
Please can you add the spiting block feature where the sticky pistons spit the block out on a 1 tick pulse to MC be

act like Java sticky pistons and only spit out on a 1 tick pulse
i really hope this one to be added

I believe adding the spit to one a one ticked piston would help bridge the gap between Java and bedrock redstone, without a need for a redo. One tick pulses are make contraptions like two way flying machines and piston doors unbelievably simpler.
This would help out so much, you could be able to build Java farms such as gold farms, ghast farms and many more that require building above bedrock in the nether.
With the 1.17 Update maybe Heights in the Bedrock nether will be overworked.
Its a small thing but it is so big in The experience of playing minecraft
Si, sabian que eso antes pasaba en la halpa de minecraft pe y otras versiones pero despues lo eliminaron o ucurio un bug
How do you create health bars ?
Yep, Bedrock hasn't got this feature since Java 1.8 version.
You can use tridents as both a melee and a ranged weapon.

Bedrock Trident Drowned will stack their natural melee damage with the weapon's base damage (possibly buffed with enchantments as well), whereas Java Drowned only ever has ranged damage, making the mob somewhat easier in comparison.

Though I do also want Java's throwing range (~20 block radius) be implemented into Bedrock (~5-10 block radius).
it's not even a full block in java (only when the item dropped)

For your info, the Bedrock Wither has 600hp, and on Java the wither has 300hp. Bedrock Withers also have a Dash Attack which does the same amount of damage. And fighting the wither on bedrock in hard mode is called The Wither Challenge because even with Protection 4 full diamond, it is still difficult. Either way Bedrock withers still only drop 1 Nether Star. I think Java wither should be buffed, but not have more drops
The death effect should cause an explosion.

Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
I can hear lightning at y 11 when it thunder storms in my worls

I came to make similar feedback. My first contribution to this website in fact!

I have turned the weather sounds down to nearly 0 (It is currently at 3) and cannot hear the rain anymore, but lightning still makes me jump and my ears hurt from the drastic sound. I enjoy the rain sounds but with lightning so loud and explosive I have unfortunately disabled weather audio until this is fixed, effectively ruining the aesthetic and entire point of storms.
The lightning is absolutely, shockingly loud. I'm enjoying a quiet snowfall in the mountains and suddenly the lightning is making me fall out of my chair.

6 years and the Google search results are identical. Please let's get some movement on this! I need it to get muffled when indoors/near the opening of a cage, significantly fewer lightning strikes, even rarer close ones, and audio that matches the distance and sounds less like TNT. Please at least just lay the ground work and let players build the resource packs to make it happen.
It's disappointing how the GUIs for these blocks look like in Bedrock. They're so basic compared to Java and don't look like much time or effort was put into them.

I found this suggestion today after watching a snapshot review for 1.16 and noticing how much nicer the loom and stonecutter UIs are on Java. Why does Bedrock get such basic interfaces when the ones on Java are much more useful and nicer looking? Bedrock FTL!
In my opinion chicken jockeys are more iconic, and they lose their originality when the concept is watered down to "zombies can ride things"
Java needs this
Java needs this
@tryashtar So you don't like how the Jockeys are set up in Bedrock?
Yeah I personally would prefer chickens as the only mount for zombies (i.e. what java has)

idk. I would say it should be in both versions, but baby zombies will prefer to ride some other mobs over others

Favourite mobs to ride: (Top=1st) (bottom=last)

Chicken (1st)

Adult zombies (2nd)

Zombie Horses (3rd)

Horses, Donkeys, Mules, Skeleton horses (4th)

Spiders and cave spiders (5th

Wolves and Cats, ocelots (6th)

Pigs, sheeps, and cows. (7th)

Pandas (8th)

I agreed. If you have both Chicken Jockey and Baby Zombie Jockey in Java Edition, you'll have a lot of fun and horror.
Baby Zombie Jockey feels something sly with Bedrock Edition alone.
I think it's better to implement both in both editions.

P.S. After that, I researched various things. Then
About baby zombified piglin, it was removed when it was a zombie pigman, and it turned out that baby drowned does not have baby zombie jockey.
There is a chicken jockey, but this is also unfair.
So I came up with an idea.
Baby zombified piglins will be revived to allow them to ride adult zombified piglins and other zombies and mobs, behave like other zombies for baby drowned, and ride on turtles exclusively for him.
That adds some challenge to the game.

People say Combat System doesn't work because of the computer language. C ++ is not designed to develop such complex mechanics, but with Java this is not a problem! C ++ has more to offer when it comes to graphics! With transparent blocks such as leaves, you can see through the block from the outside through the other side!

I want this. Bedrock edition ambience is very very BAD...

We now have nether ambience but I'm still waiting for the underwater ambience to come out. And we don't even have the entering and exiting sound. I'm really excited that in one day, I'll be able to relax just hearing this wonderful ambience. Don't you?
YESSSS!!! We need this feature
Java is my favorite edition
I really need this, Mojang!
Yes we need more grass generation.
I agree, this would be SUPER helpful for different things, especially the chunk borders when building farms.
in general having F3 functionality in bedrock would be nice

it would be so helpful to not accidentally kill any endermen when using the lead on a boat, it would also be really helpful to find ancient debris since they spawn on chunk borders and we cant see them on bedrock so it makes that tip so useless
Behavior packs/ add-ons in Java, data-packs in Bedrock... why is this not a thing already when these design choices were being made for one platform to port to the other?
There are datapacks witch are the same thing

Datapacks do not allow you to create custom behaviours (you would have to do a bunch of stuff with marker entities and that would take months to create one uniquely behaving mob as every action requires many commands, let alone choose the actions they want to do)
Modders NEED this, as currently, we can't create new mobs without mod makers and mod loaders which are equally complex for custom behaviours.

Note, you can control the behaviour of a mob slightly, however, you cannot really control what it does, only what it attacks... this is also limited by the fact that this would take a ton of commands to pull off just to make, say, a skeleton that is aggressive to pigs, no unique behaviours, just aggressive to pigs...
